Title: Clinical Domain Lead, AIDA
Job_Description:
Role Summary




Do you want to make an impact on patient health around the world through the power of data science, analytics, and engineering? Are you an innovative leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment?




Then join Pfizer Digital’s Artificial Intelligence, Data, and Analytics (AIDA) organization, where we are powering advanced analytics and AI/ML to transform how we create breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. AIDA’s mission is to accelerate, elevate, and scale AI/ML across Pfizer to drive significant business value through evidence-based, data-driven decision-making. We are Pfizer’s thought leaders on AI and its practical application, and we power advanced analytics across the enterprise by providing the foundations, expertise, and standards/policies to enable responsible AI to thrive.




The AIDA Clinical Domain Lead will serve as a strategic thought partner and key point of contact to the Early Clinical Development (ECD) organization within WRDM1 and the Global Product Development (GPD) organization to help them harness the power of data & analytics and the skills, tools, and expertise available within AIDA. Utilizing their deep knowledge of clinical development (both early and late-stage), and expertise in advanced analytics & AI, the Domain Lead will partner with the ECD and GPD organizations and their respective Digital Client Partners, as well as the GRaDEM2 Creation Center, to shape, prioritize and oversee the delivery of a portfolio of mission-critical data and analytics projects and foundations. Within AIDA, the Domain Lead will proactively serve to translate Clinical needs into a cohesive data and analytics strategy, and drive partnership and alignment across AIDA domains. This role will also serve as AIDA’s representative to the broader Pfizer Digital organization for any Clinical-related activities that Pfizer Digital is addressing. The Clinical Domain Lead and other Domain Leads will report to the Head of AIDA and serve as global leaders in the organization, including supporting continuous advancement and innovation in data engineering processing, flow, platforms, utilization, and advanced analytics capabilities. The ideal candidate must have a strong strategic perspective and desire to push the boundaries through the application of state-of-the-art AI/ML methodologies.




1 Worldwide Research, Development, & Medical




2 Global Research & Development and Medical




Role Responsibilities




Serve as the single AIDA point of contact for all Clinical Research and Development-related AIDA projects
Utilize expertise in Clinical Development, including early through late-stage clinical trials, and knowledge of data, analytics, and AI to design the most valuable solutions, advise stakeholders, and ensure implementation of the most practical approaches that achieve the desired outcomes
Work across organizational lines to connect the dots across Clinical needs and develop a cohesive strategy that serves those needs efficiently
Translate Clinical data and analytics needs and priorities into tactical projects for AIDA to lead and advance
Document needs, constraints, and requests, and own and track progress toward project completion, business impacts, and key metrics
Marshall the right resources and expertise within AIDA to deliver data and analytics capabilities that best accelerate the clinical development of breakthrough medicines
Establish effective partnerships with and influence leaders in other areas of Digital to collectively deliver on discrete projects and larger programs
Illustrate the “art of the possible” and proactively propose ideas, innovative approaches, use cases, or external collaborations that Clinical teams might find valuable
Foster collaboration across AIDA, Digital, and other colleagues to identify and communicate strategic lessons learned and best practices, promoting continuous improvement in Clinical project execution
Partner with other Domain Leads develop best practices, learn from each other, and evolve the role, with the goal of delivering transformational impact to the organization
Maintain an active external network in the life sciences AI/ML community to understand state-of-the-art capabilities and potential impacts to Pfizer’s ECD and GPD groups




Basic Qualifications




13+ years of experience working in the Clinical function within a biopharmaceutical company or serving the Clinical function as a management consultant or service provider
Advanced degree in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline
Experience translating preclinical observations to clinical studies and using Digital capabilities in the clinic
Working knowledge of bioinformatics, clinical / medical informatics, computational biology, and AI/ML
Deep understanding of biopharmaceutical clinical trial data, and ability to formulate data strategy
Nuanced insight into the opportunities and challenges presented with applying AI/ML to business problems within the life sciences industry
Ability to translate ambiguous customer needs into tangible and achievable strategy and plans
Proactive, agile, and innovative leader, who can creatively solve problems and operate effectively in a rapidly evolving, varied environment (e.g., technical and business, executive and non-executive audiences)
Track record of successful internal and/or external program management and strategic planning, working with highly matrixed teams within health, medical, life science or related organizations
Strategic mindset, including the ability to prioritize tasks and projects, identify the most relevant parameters driving a business decision, and to focus the work accordingly
Very strong organizational skills, ability to successfully deliver with cross-functional, matrixed teams on multiple projects at the same time, and ability to influence without direct authority
Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills, and teaming ability




Preferred Qualifications




PhD in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline or an MBA
Hands-on experience shepherding a clinical development project (focus on Phase 2 and 3) from study design through submission
Demonstrated successful execution and management of multiple, simultaneous projects
Experience applying advanced analytics and AI/ML to clinical trials
Experience in a high-growth environment, standing up new teams and technologies




Extensive computer use, ability to work at a rapid pace, in a virtual environment.




Some travel will be required as part of this role. Expectations around travel will vary but you will need to be capable of travel within the region and to other regions.




This role may on occasion require physical or virtual participation on a weekend, holiday, or after normal business hours.




Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.




Work Location Assignment: Flexible




Last Date to Apply for Job: 1/15/2023




The annual base salary for this position ranges from $178,700.00 to $297,700.00. In addition, this position offers an annual bonus with a target of 22.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. Benefits offered include a retirement savings plan, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans. Salary range does not apply to the Tampa, FL location.




Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.




Pfizer requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, Pfizer will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.




Sunshine Act




Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.




EEO & Employment Eligibility




Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

Title: Javascript Developer

HelloSivi is an AI design companion, it turns text content into visual designs instantly. We are a well-funded young thriving startup, looking for passionate Javascript developers to design the AI interfaces and its backend.

Hiring for two separate roles

Frontend Engineers

Backend Engineers

What is expected?

Passion to work on Javascript and related frameworks.

Strong JS knowledge

Fair knowledge of cloud technologies.

Problem-solving ability

Good communication to interact with the teammates.

What do you get?

Work will be exciting, day in and day out you will be solving interesting problems.

Chance to work on cutting-edge technologies.

Good compensation

Startup culture

Mutual learning

We are Pfizer’s thought leaders on AI and its practical application, and we power advanced analytics across the enterprise by providing the foundations, expertise, and standards/policies to enable responsible AI to thrive.




The AIDA Clinical Domain Lead will serve as a strategic thought partner and key point of contact to the Early Clinical Development (ECD) organization within WRDM1 and the Global Product Development (GPD) organization to help them harness the power of data & analytics and the skills, tools, and expertise available within AIDA. Utilizing their deep knowledge of clinical development (both early and late-stage), and expertise in advanced analytics & AI, the Domain Lead will partner with the ECD and GPD organizations and their respective Digital Client Partners, as well as the GRaDEM2 Creation Center, to shape, prioritize and oversee the delivery of a portfolio of mission-critical data and analytics projects and foundations. Within AIDA, the Domain Lead will proactively serve to translate Clinical needs into a cohesive data and analytics strategy, and drive partnership and alignment across AIDA domains. This role will also serve as AIDA’s representative to the broader Pfizer Digital organization for any Clinical-related activities that Pfizer Digital is addressing. The Clinical Domain Lead and other Domain Leads will report to the Head of AIDA and serve as global leaders in the organization, including supporting continuous advancement and innovation in data engineering processing, flow, platforms, utilization, and advanced analytics capabilities. The ideal candidate must have a strong strategic perspective and desire to push the boundaries through the application of state-of-the-art AI/ML methodologies.




1 Worldwide Research, Development, & Medical




2 Global Research & Development and Medical




Role Responsibilities




Serve as the single AIDA point of contact for all Clinical Research and Development-related AIDA projects
Utilize expertise in Clinical Development, including early through late-stage clinical trials, and knowledge of data, analytics, and AI to design the most valuable solutions, advise stakeholders, and ensure implementation of the most practical approaches that achieve the desired outcomes
Work across organizational lines to connect the dots across Clinical needs and develop a cohesive strategy that serves those needs efficiently
Translate Clinical data and analytics needs and priorities into tactical projects for AIDA to lead and advance
Document needs, constraints, and requests, and own and track progress toward project completion, business impacts, and key metrics
Marshall the right resources and expertise within AIDA to deliver data and analytics capabilities that best accelerate the clinical development of breakthrough medicines
Establish effective partnerships with and influence leaders in other areas of Digital to collectively deliver on discrete projects and larger programs
Illustrate the “art of the possible” and proactively propose ideas, innovative approaches, use cases, or external collaborations that Clinical teams might find valuable
Foster collaboration across AIDA, Digital, and other colleagues to identify and communicate strategic lessons learned and best practices, promoting continuous improvement in Clinical project execution
Partner with other Domain Leads develop best practices, learn from each other, and evolve the role, with the goal of delivering transformational impact to the organization
Maintain an active external network in the life sciences AI/ML community to understand state-of-the-art capabilities and potential impacts to Pfizer’s ECD and GPD groups




Basic Qualifications




13+ years of experience working in the Clinical function within a biopharmaceutical company or serving the Clinical function as a management consultant or service provider
Advanced degree in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline
Experience translating preclinical observations to clinical studies and using Digital capabilities in the clinic
Working knowledge of bioinformatics, clinical / medical informatics, computational biology, and AI/ML
Deep understanding of biopharmaceutical clinical trial data, and ability to formulate data strategy
Nuanced insight into the opportunities and challenges presented with applying AI/ML to business problems within the life sciences industry
Ability to translate ambiguous customer needs into tangible and achievable strategy and plans
Proactive, agile, and innovative leader, who can creatively solve problems and operate effectively in a rapidly evolving, varied environment (e.g., technical and business, executive and non-executive audiences)
Track record of successful internal and/or external program management and strategic planning, working with highly matrixed teams within health, medical, life science or related organizations
Strategic mindset, including the ability to prioritize tasks and projects, identify the most relevant parameters driving a business decision, and to focus the work accordingly
Very strong organizational skills, ability to successfully deliver with cross-functional, matrixed teams on multiple projects at the same time, and ability to influence without direct authority
Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills, and teaming ability




Preferred Qualifications




PhD in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline or an MBA
Hands-on experience shepherding a clinical development project (focus on Phase 2 and 3) from study design through submission
Demonstrated successful execution and management of multiple, simultaneous projects
Experience applying advanced analytics and AI/ML to clinical trials
Experience in a high-growth environment, standing up new teams and technologies




Extensive computer use, ability to work at a rapid pace, in a virtual environment.




Some travel will be required as part of this role. Expectations around travel will vary but you will need to be capable of travel within the region and to other regions.




This role may on occasion require physical or virtual participation on a weekend, holiday, or after normal business hours.




Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.




Work Location Assignment: Flexible




Last Date to Apply for Job: 1/15/2023




The annual base salary for this position ranges from $178,700.00 to $297,700.00. In addition, this position offers an annual bonus with a target of 22.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. Benefits offered include a retirement savings plan, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans. Salary range does not apply to the Tampa, FL location.




Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.




Pfizer requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, Pfizer will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.




Sunshine Act




Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.




EEO & Employment Eligibility




Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

Title: Product Owner INTERN (Civil Engineering and Construction)
Job_Description: The $12 Trillion construction industry is one of the “least digitalized” industries and has a major productivity problem. We are empowering the construction industry with the No-Code AI to accelerate the digital transformation and help close the productivity gap.TasksJoin us to solve some cutting-edge construction tech problems and be a part of international POCs & Pilots.Apply your civil engineering, architecture and general AEC domain know-how to contribute to the definition and design of AI use cases in construction and overall product development. This also includes taking part in customer discussions to capture functional and user experience requirementsPerform usability and user acceptance testingsSupport in the definition of Ontology, e.g. create taxonomies to steer the AI and design construction processes to monitor using AIRequirementsStudents of Master and PhD programs in Civil Engineering or Architecture, with focus on construction management, construction innovation or informatics (Bauinformatik)This is a unique opportunity to apply your academic knowledge & skills in real world applications and learn from experts.

Title: Biopharma Domain Lead, AIDA
Job_Description:
For more than 170 years, Pfizer has continuously worked to make a difference by delivering innovative therapies that improve the lives of our patients. By building a talented community of colleagues that align with our patient-focused purpose and core values, Pfizer has improved global health and impacted more than 780 million patients around the world.




Role Summary




Do you want to make an impact on patient health around the world through the power of data science, analytics, and engineering? Are you an innovative leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment?




Then join Pfizer Digital’s Artificial Intelligence, Data, and Analytics (AIDA) organization, where we are powering advanced analytics and AI/ML to transform how we create breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. AIDA’s mission is to accelerate, elevate, and scale AI/ML across Pfizer to drive significant business value through evidence-based, data-driven decision-making. We are Pfizer’s thought leaders on AI and its practical application, and we power advanced analytics across the enterprise by providing the foundations, expertise, and standards/policies to enable responsible AI to thrive.




The AIDA Biopharma Domain Lead will serve as a strategic thought partner and key point of contact to the Commercial and Medical Affairs teams within Pfizer’s Biopharma group to help them harness the power of data & analytics and the skills, tools, and expertise available within AIDA. Utilizing their deep knowledge of Commercial and Medical Affairs in the biopharmaceutical industry and their expertise in advanced analytics & AI, the Domain Lead will partner with the Biopharma organization, Biopharma Digital Client Partner, and Customer Experience, Commercial Enablement & Market Facing Solutions Creation Center to shape, prioritize and oversee the delivery of a portfolio of mission-critical data and analytics projects and foundations. Within AIDA, the Domain Lead will proactively serve to translate Biopharma needs into a cohesive data and analytics strategy, and drive partnership and alignment across AIDA domains. This role will also serve as AIDA’s representative to the broader Pfizer Digital organization for any Biopharma-related activities that Pfizer Digital is addressing. The Biopharma Domain Lead and other Domain Leads will report to the Head of AIDA and serve as global leaders in the organization, including supporting continuous advancement and innovation in data engineering processing, flow, platforms, utilization, and advanced analytics capabilities. The ideal candidate must have a strong strategic perspective and desire to push the boundaries through the application of state-of-the-art AI/ML methodologies.




Role Responsibilities




Serve as the single AIDA point of contact for all Biopharma-related AIDA projects
Utilize expertise in biopharmaceutical industry Commercial and Medical Affairs functions and knowledge of data, analytics, and AI to design the most valuable solutions, advise stakeholders, and ensure implementation of the most practical approaches that achieve the desired outcomes
Work across organizational lines to connect the dots across Biopharma’s needs and develop a cohesive strategy that serves those needs efficiently
Identify opportunities to use predictive and prescriptive analytics, decision support, and digital health and medicine capabilities to bring the right medicines to patients faster and ensure next best action
Partner with Clinical Informatics and PHI organizations to ensure best use of real-world data (RWD), advanced analytics, and predictive / descriptive analytics
Translate Biopharma’s data and analytics needs and priorities into tactical projects for AIDA to lead and advance
Document needs, constraints, and requests, and own and track progress toward project completion, business impacts, and key metrics
Marshall the right resources and expertise within AIDA to deliver data and analytics capabilities that best accelerate the commercial launch of breakthrough medicines and other post-approval processes
Establish effective partnerships with and influence leaders in other areas of Digital to collectively deliver on discrete projects and larger programs
Illustrate the “art of the possible” and proactively propose ideas, innovative approaches, use cases, or external collaborations that Biopharma might find valuable
Foster collaboration across AIDA, Digital, and other colleagues to identify and communicate strategic lessons learned and best practices, promoting continuous improvement in Biopharma project execution
Partner with other Domain Leads develop best practices, learn from each other, and evolve the role, with the goal of delivering transformational impact to the organization
Maintain an active external network in the life sciences AI/ML community to understand state-of-the-art capabilities and potential impacts to Pfizer’s Biopharma group




Basic Qualifications




13+ years of experience working in the Commercial or Medical Affairs function including sales, marketing, HEOR, etc. within a biopharmaceutical company or serving those functions as a management consultant or service provider
Advanced degree in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline
Working knowledge of bioinformatics, computational biology, and AI/ML
Deep understanding of biopharmaceutical Commercial data, including sales and forecasting, health economics and outcomes data, marketing and spend data, patient and physician data, and ability to formulate data strategy
Nuanced insight into the opportunities and challenges presented with applying AI/ML to business problems within the life sciences industry
Ability to translate ambiguous customer needs into tangible and achievable strategy and plans
Proactive, agile, and innovative leader, who can creatively solve problems and operate effectively in a rapidly evolving, varied environment (e.g., technical and business, executive and non-executive audiences)
Track record of successful internal and/or external program management and strategic planning, working with highly matrixed teams within health, medical, life science or related organizations
Strategic mindset, including the ability to prioritize tasks and projects, identify the most relevant parameters driving a business decision, and to focus the work accordingly
Very strong organizational skills, ability to successfully deliver with cross-functional, matrixed teams on multiple projects at the same time, and ability to influence without direct authority
Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills, and teaming ability
Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact




Preferred Qualifications




PhD in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline or an MBA
Hands-on experience in generating and applying analytical insights to inform portfolio, disease, brand strategies
Hands-on experience managing the commercial launch of a biopharmaceutical product in the market and overseeing other post-approval activities
Demonstrated successful execution and management of multiple, simultaneous projects
Experience applying advanced analytics and AI/ML to biopharmaceutical Commercial and/or Medical Affairs needs
Experience in a high-growth environment, standing up new teams and technologies




Non-standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment Requirements




Some travel will be required as part of this role. Expectations around travel will vary but you will need to be capable of travel within the region and to other regions.
This role may on occasion require physical or virtual participation on a weekend, holiday, or after normal business hours.




ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS




Frequent interactions: Internal Customers (e.g., Biopharma), Head of AIDA, AI/ML CoE Lead, Analytics & Industrialization Lead, Data Lead, Platforms & Products Lead, Global Support Lead
Additional interactions: Other Domain Leads (e.g., Research), Digital Client Partners, other Digital Leads

Additional Location Information: Groton, CT; Cambridge, MA; Collegeville, PA
Work Location Assignment: Flexible

Benefits offered include a retirement savings plan, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans. Salary range does not apply to the Tampa, FL location.

Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.




EEO & Employment Eligibility




Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.




Information & Business Tech

Title: Sr Product Designer (Data Viz + B2B) (Contract-to-Hire) [Remote]
Job_Description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works – for good.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Partial overlap)
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $110 – $130/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term


THE OPPORTUNITY

What you’ll be working on

Our client's team is seeking a talented Senior Product Designer with strong UI skills and well versed in design systems!

Imagine yourself in the 1970s or 80s thinking through how computing should look and feel for people who had never seen it before. That's what they're trying to do — Their designers create powerful, impactful experiences that enable users of all kinds at organizations to work effectively with data to orchestrate complex marketing campaigns driven by AI. Sometimes that means cutting through the noise and delivering highly streamlined, simple experiences and sometimes it means designing productivity tools for very technical audiences.

They're excited to be growing a team as diverse and creative as the millions of people they reach worldwide, and a company where everyone can thrive.

What You Will Do

Design solutions to real problems and ship great features in their UI
Craft every detail of new product features, from idea to UX to pixel-perfect execution.
Work relentlessly to understand their customers
Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering and product to craft thorough experiences that are a joy to use
Work in the best medium for the stage of the product development lifecycle you're in, whether that be documents, mockups, prototypes, or presentations
Orient solutions around clear goals, audiences, timeframes, and realistic technical capabilities while always pushing to deliver the best possible experience
Participate in design reviews and share your work regularly with the design/product team and company leadership
Create new patterns that are intuitive, practical, and convergent. Evolve their design system intentionally as they scale.


What They’re Looking For

You have well-rounded skills and experience to run projects independently end to end. 6+ years of working experience designing consumer or business SaaS applications (Enterprise product experience is a plus).
You can create clear, intuitive, and visually appealing human interfaces. (UI)
You can untangle vague conceptual problems, and have a sharp intuition for the most accessible mental models and flows, so users can immediately start gaining value from the product. (UX)
You love making complex problems feel simple and seeing the larger system connect disparate pieces to visualize the user's journey
You have experience in designing Data systems with complex information hierarchies and representing the output of AI
The design decision you make are data driven
You can do basic coding in HTML + CSS + basic Javascript. (Even better if you're capable of the procedure or React-level Javascript.)
You care about the business needs, implications, and practicality of your designs. You don't get stuck on pretty UI or deep abstractions and can balance between craft, speed, and the bottom line.
You have strong beliefs, loosely held. You're a good listener who collaborates well with different stakeholders. You observe and internalize all inputs and feedback to help you reach an optimal decision.
You like to tell stories using both words and visuals and strategize the best way to make your point.
You have a strong portfolio that showcases your work, provides details of your role on projects, and shows examples of functional designs that you have developed from start to finish


Bonus points

You have experience working in the data and AI space
You have notion of motion design
You've designed and built great tools with small teams in the past.
You bring unique strengths and perspectives to the team. Our client is looking to build a diverse team where their skills and experience can complement each other.
You can polish features in the codebase.** They love to hire designers who can code so there's less communication and hand-off cost with engineers. But this is optional, especially if you are super talented in designing the purest and easiest solution to hard product design problems, and rallying your teammates to execute it.*
You've experienced the pain of fragmented tools and information silos created by them, and have a strong urge to fix it.


Apply Now!

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Biopharma Domain Lead, AIDA
Job_Description:
For more than 170 years, Pfizer has continuously worked to make a difference by delivering innovative therapies that improve the lives of our patients. By building a talented community of colleagues that align with our patient-focused purpose and core values, Pfizer has improved global health and impacted more than 780 million patients around the world.




Role Summary




Do you want to make an impact on patient health around the world through the power of data science, analytics, and engineering? Are you an innovative leader who thrives in a fast-paced environment?




Then join Pfizer Digital’s Artificial Intelligence, Data, and Analytics (AIDA) organization, where we are powering advanced analytics and AI/ML to transform how we create breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. AIDA’s mission is to accelerate, elevate, and scale AI/ML across Pfizer to drive significant business value through evidence-based, data-driven decision-making. We are Pfizer’s thought leaders on AI and its practical application, and we power advanced analytics across the enterprise by providing the foundations, expertise, and standards/policies to enable responsible AI to thrive.




The AIDA Biopharma Domain Lead will serve as a strategic thought partner and key point of contact to the Commercial and Medical Affairs teams within Pfizer’s Biopharma group to help them harness the power of data & analytics and the skills, tools, and expertise available within AIDA. Utilizing their deep knowledge of Commercial and Medical Affairs in the biopharmaceutical industry and their expertise in advanced analytics & AI, the Domain Lead will partner with the Biopharma organization, Biopharma Digital Client Partner, and Customer Experience, Commercial Enablement & Market Facing Solutions Creation Center to shape, prioritize and oversee the delivery of a portfolio of mission-critical data and analytics projects and foundations. Within AIDA, the Domain Lead will proactively serve to translate Biopharma needs into a cohesive data and analytics strategy, and drive partnership and alignment across AIDA domains. This role will also serve as AIDA’s representative to the broader Pfizer Digital organization for any Biopharma-related activities that Pfizer Digital is addressing. The Biopharma Domain Lead and other Domain Leads will report to the Head of AIDA and serve as global leaders in the organization, including supporting continuous advancement and innovation in data engineering processing, flow, platforms, utilization, and advanced analytics capabilities. The ideal candidate must have a strong strategic perspective and desire to push the boundaries through the application of state-of-the-art AI/ML methodologies.




Role Responsibilities




Serve as the single AIDA point of contact for all Biopharma-related AIDA projects
Utilize expertise in biopharmaceutical industry Commercial and Medical Affairs functions and knowledge of data, analytics, and AI to design the most valuable solutions, advise stakeholders, and ensure implementation of the most practical approaches that achieve the desired outcomes
Work across organizational lines to connect the dots across Biopharma’s needs and develop a cohesive strategy that serves those needs efficiently
Identify opportunities to use predictive and prescriptive analytics, decision support, and digital health and medicine capabilities to bring the right medicines to patients faster and ensure next best action
Partner with Clinical Informatics and PHI organizations to ensure best use of real-world data (RWD), advanced analytics, and predictive / descriptive analytics
Translate Biopharma’s data and analytics needs and priorities into tactical projects for AIDA to lead and advance
Document needs, constraints, and requests, and own and track progress toward project completion, business impacts, and key metrics
Marshall the right resources and expertise within AIDA to deliver data and analytics capabilities that best accelerate the commercial launch of breakthrough medicines and other post-approval processes
Establish effective partnerships with and influence leaders in other areas of Digital to collectively deliver on discrete projects and larger programs
Illustrate the “art of the possible” and proactively propose ideas, innovative approaches, use cases, or external collaborations that Biopharma might find valuable
Foster collaboration across AIDA, Digital, and other colleagues to identify and communicate strategic lessons learned and best practices, promoting continuous improvement in Biopharma project execution
Partner with other Domain Leads develop best practices, learn from each other, and evolve the role, with the goal of delivering transformational impact to the organization
Maintain an active external network in the life sciences AI/ML community to understand state-of-the-art capabilities and potential impacts to Pfizer’s Biopharma group




Basic Qualifications




13+ years of experience working in the Commercial or Medical Affairs function including sales, marketing, HEOR, etc. within a biopharmaceutical company or serving those functions as a management consultant or service provider
Advanced degree in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline
Working knowledge of bioinformatics, computational biology, and AI/ML
Deep understanding of biopharmaceutical Commercial data, including sales and forecasting, health economics and outcomes data, marketing and spend data, patient and physician data, and ability to formulate data strategy
Nuanced insight into the opportunities and challenges presented with applying AI/ML to business problems within the life sciences industry
Ability to translate ambiguous customer needs into tangible and achievable strategy and plans
Proactive, agile, and innovative leader, who can creatively solve problems and operate effectively in a rapidly evolving, varied environment (e.g., technical and business, executive and non-executive audiences)
Track record of successful internal and/or external program management and strategic planning, working with highly matrixed teams within health, medical, life science or related organizations
Strategic mindset, including the ability to prioritize tasks and projects, identify the most relevant parameters driving a business decision, and to focus the work accordingly
Very strong organizational skills, ability to successfully deliver with cross-functional, matrixed teams on multiple projects at the same time, and ability to influence without direct authority
Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal skills, and teaming ability
Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact




Preferred Qualifications




PhD in a scientific, biomedical, or engineering discipline or an MBA
Hands-on experience in generating and applying analytical insights to inform portfolio, disease, brand strategies
Hands-on experience managing the commercial launch of a biopharmaceutical product in the market and overseeing other post-approval activities
Demonstrated successful execution and management of multiple, simultaneous projects
Experience applying advanced analytics and AI/ML to biopharmaceutical Commercial and/or Medical Affairs needs
Experience in a high-growth environment, standing up new teams and technologies




Non-standard Work Schedule, Travel Or Environment Requirements




Some travel will be required as part of this role. Expectations around travel will vary but you will need to be capable of travel within the region and to other regions.
This role may on occasion require physical or virtual participation on a weekend, holiday, or after normal business hours.




ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS




Frequent interactions: Internal Customers (e.g., Biopharma), Head of AIDA, AI/ML CoE Lead, Analytics & Industrialization Lead, Data Lead, Platforms & Products Lead, Global Support Lead
Additional interactions: Other Domain Leads (e.g., Research), Digital Client Partners, other Digital Leads




Other Job Details:




Last Date to Apply for Job: January 15, 2023
Additional Location Information: Groton, CT; Cambridge, MA; Collegeville, PA
Work Location Assignment: Flexible




The annual base salary for this position ranges from $178,700.00 to $297,700.00. In addition, this position offers an annual bonus with a target of 22.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. Benefits offered include a retirement savings plan, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans. Salary range does not apply to the Tampa, FL location.




Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.




Pfizer requires all U.S. new hires to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 prior to the first date of employment. As required by applicable law, Pfizer will consider requests for Reasonable Accommodations.




Sunshine Act




Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.




EEO & Employment Eligibility




Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer.

Title: AI & CPU Senior Design Engineer
Job_Description:
The position is located within the Processing IPs product line in Singapore site (Pasir Ris). We aim at building a strong core team of 10 technical people during the first semester of 2022 in order to reach 20 people by the end of 2022.

You will be a AI & CPU Senior Design Engineer dedicated to the Processing business and help drive Dolphin Design’s product development. As a member of a multi-disciplinary team, you will be expected to develop the best architecture of the product targeting very edge-IoT applications (sensor fusion, keyword spotting, object detection, image classification, …) including machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) aspects. You will help drive insightful and critical design decisions to reach performance and power target objectives for product such as CHAMELEON micro-controller, PANTHER DSP, and RAPTOR neural processing unit.

AI & CPU senior design engineers at Dolphin Design are given key responsibilities at the development stage of our DSP and NPU product development pipeline, including early discussions to assess product requirements, rapid feature development and deployment. Candidates for this role must have a strong and multi-disciplinary technical background and the ability to drive results across organizational boundaries.

YOUR MAIN MISSIONS

Product development

Work closely with system architects and the product line manager to define the product feature.

Responsible for the technical choices and features of the product. Propose the appropriate architecture during the feasibility phase of the project. Make trade-offs between requirements (technical and non-technical) and development costs.

Specify the detailed product hardware architecture to enable front-end activities execution. Support the software development team.

Responsible for the design implementation choices and features development of the product considering functional and power aware aspects.

It Includes

Specification of the micro-architecture
RTL code development and optimization. May include low-power aspects
Lint checks and Clock Domain Crossing (CDC) checks

Specify the timing constraints (SDC) of the product to enable middle-end activities execution (synthesis, equivalence checks, timing analysis).

As owner of the architecture, you will provide support to project team members during project execution particularly to verification engineers.

Methodology

Contribute to the continuous improvement and maintenance of the design methodology and flow.

Add to the in-house expertise regarding design to consult with, educate, and train design staff members.

Provide training and support to other team members,
Continuous improvements following latest techniques, tools, and technologies.
Project execution:

Provide internal support and guidance for design activities. Participate in project assessment, set-up and execution working closely with project managers and others team members

Required Skills

Bachelor's Degree w/ 8+ years or MS w/ 5+ years or PhD w/ 3+ years in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science or related equivalent.
5+ years as a design engineer, establishing state-of-the-art design.
Proficient in RTL coding including design checks (lint, CDC, coding rules ..)
Knowledge of ML/AI design architecture is a big plus
Experience in UPF design is a plus

Technical Skills

Strong knowledge of CPU micro-architecture (processor pipeline, cache, dma, memory system, peripherals) and integration at SOC level
Able to make trade-offs between power, performance and area appropriately to meet the requirements of the product
Understanding of neural network architecture
Experience with ARM/RISCV core architecture
RTL coding (VHDL, Verilog, SystemVerilog), lint, CDC checks
Lint, CDC methodology with Questa CDC is a plus
Low-power design and implementation flows
Knowledge of C / Assembly programming for embedded systems
EDA tools from Cadence, Mentor and Synopsys covering all steps of the flow
Scripting: Tcl, Shell, Perl, Python …
Linux/Windows working environment

Other Skills

Leadership skills
Good verbal and written communication skills. (English is a must)
Flexible, proactive and result/delivery oriented across organizational boundaries
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Ability to work as individual contributor as well as a team player

Package

Base + AWS + variable bonus
Benefits: Term-life, Hospitalization, Outpatient General Practitioner, Outpatient Specialist

Who Are We

We are a subsidiary of Soitec, and an innovative and fast-growing semiconductor company.

We are now opening our new dedicated Edge Computing and AI branch at the same facility in Singapore (Pasir Ris). Our vision is to enable the largest possible AIoT / EDGE IoT semiconductor community to deliver products with ultimate energy efficiency and performance. Our mantra is simple: "Consume less energy while increasing performance". This requires a combination of the "best of breed" in power management, triggering interfaces, audio chain, MCU subsystem architecture and AI HW gas pedal.

Title: Senior Game Designer (Zombies) - Treyarch Vancouver
Job_Description:
Job Title

Senior Game Designer (Zombies) - Treyarch Vancouver

Requisition ID

R018644

Job Description

Heed the call of the never-ending hordes of the undead! Channel your passion to create the next Call of Duty Zombies experiences. As a Treyarch Senior Game Designer working on our Zombies mode, together we will turn nightmarish, adrenaline-fueled dreams into reality!

What You’ll Do…

Act as a Point Designer, the Game Design point of contact who represents your small team of Game Designers for your assigned map and who provides oversight to the team itself.
Work with Design Leadership to create designs and bring them to fruition using scripting and our level editor.
Participate in regular playtests, give feedback and provide recommendations for next iterative direction.
Work with production and leadership to reach product goals.
Learn and grow by collaborating with industry veterans across a wide spectrum of professions.
Mentor other designers as opportunities arise.
Contribute to the success of the team by sharing your unique knowledge and experiences with others, look for opportunities to improve our processes and practices and be an example of treating people with respect.

To succeed you should have…

The ability to contribute directly to the game while also providing oversight on content and team members.
Proficiency with one or more scripting or programming languages (C-like languages a plus).
The ability to clearly articulate and communicate design ideas using any text and visuals to a diverse audience ranging from the visually inclined to the technically minded.
The ability to weigh pluses and minuses to design choices to find the one that best fits the situation, even if that means finding a new solution that no one has thought of.

We’d love it if you also have…

Experience working in a position with Job Responsibilities similar to the above listing with a team of at least 3 game designers in a professional setting.
Proficiency with debugging and problem solving.
Experience with first or third person shooter game design.
Experience with quest design, especially involving multiple cooperative players.
Experience with Live Support (patching a live product).
Experience with AI design and/or tuning.

We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This role is expected to begin as a remote position. We understand each person’s circumstances may be unique and will work with you to explore possible interim options.

About Treyarch

Founded in 1996, Treyarch is a videogame studio whose purpose is to create awesome games for the world to enjoy. With this purpose in mind, we crafted the award winning Call of Duty: Black Ops series and pioneered the fan favorite Zombies mode.

At Treyarch, we empower the team to be individually driven to innovate on our games, processes, and culture. How we do things is just as important as what we do.

Studio culture and development, we believe it’s a team effort and that collaboration and hearing one another is key. Every day we face the large and small challenges together and every voice matters.

These values guide us in our mission to create moments that matter. Both to the players and to us, the creators. In an era where triumphs and defeats are readily shared, seeing players engage with our creations gives us great pride. Come help us create that next moment.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

To learn more about our studio, please visit us at www.treyarch.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/treyarch, and @treyarch on Twitter.

PS, we’ve also got some pretty amazing office perks and benefits, like 20 vacation days and 16 holidays, 10 weeks of family leave, free lunches and snacks at our office, comprehensive healthcare, and more! Check out all the details here for more information: https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/

Rewards

Subject To Eligibility Requirements, The Company Offers Comprehensive Benefits Including

We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered.

Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.

Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.

In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $80,800.00 - $149,400.00 Annual. This base pay range is for the U.S. and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

Title: Visual Merchandising Executive | Marks & Spencer
Job_Description:
Job Description




Key Responsibilities:

- In-charge of floor layout footages as well as Atrium and Pop-up store layout

- In-charge of Equipment/Props

- Processing of VM invoices via SAP usage

- In-charge of ordering props/equipment for store development and Christmas

Responsibilities:

- Deliver company standard of VM at store level from window display, in-store images, hotspots, soft displays, in-store décor to ticketing.

- Maximise selling opportunities through effective VM implementation that is in line with corporate guidelines and meet deadlines.

- Make use of VM materials in an effective and cost-efficient manner.

- Apply efficient and effective way of workings in order to improve self-productivity.

- Provide creative inputs and recommendations in VM area.

- Ensure the agreed visual merchandising standards and guidelines on merchandise and store presentation is implemented

- Install visual merchandising POS collateral for events and promotions

- Implement company visual merchandising standards and guidelines

- Maintain effective communication links among VM team, store commercial team, marketing team and own team.

- Add value to the Team by sharing market observations, knowledge and connections.




Requirements

- Diploma in Visual Merchandising or equivalent with at least 3 years’ experience in fashion retail VM

- Basic Knowledge of AutoCAD

- Knowledge on Photoshop/ AI/ In-design

- Able to work independently and under pressure with tight schedule

- Be open and positive about criticism

- Highly creative with strong fashion and styling sense

Title: [SiaXperience] - CDI - Copywriter - bilingual French/English H/F
Job_Description:
Description de l'entreprise




SiaXperience is the ecosystem that develops connectivity between brands and consumers with a powerful analytical bias at the service of best practices in creativity and design. SiaXperience generates 20 million euros in revenue with 120 designers, marketing consultants and digital experts working in 10 design centers: Paris, Lyon, London, Amsterdam, Montreal, Los Angeles, New York, San Francisco Bay, Seattle, Hong Kong. SiaXperience is at the heart of Sia Partners' strategy to develop its design, creativity and customer experience activities, alongside management and strategy consulting, and artificial intelligence.




Sia Partners is a next-generation management consulting firm and pioneer of Consulting 4.0. We offer a unique blend of AI and design capabilities, augmenting traditional consulting to deliver superior value to our clients. With expertise in more than 30 sectors and services, we optimize client projects worldwide. Through our Consulting for Good approach, we strive for next-level impact by developing innovative CSR solutions for our clients, making sustainability a lever for profitable transformation.




Description du poste




As a French/English Copywriter at SiaXperience, you are in charge of developing creative concepts to respond to client briefs. As a lover of words, you know how to handle them with humor and sensitivity, to reach international audiences and targets. You are the driving force and guarantor of the conception of campaigns and storytelling. You will work on behalf of our clients operating in various sectors (energy, banking, transport, public sector, corporate, luxury, lifestyle, consumer goods, tech, etc.).




Working with the creative team (UX/UI Designers, Motion Designers, ADs, Tech Experts as well as CRM Consultants, etc.) and under the responsibility of the Creative Director, your missions will be to:




Help out on branding and communication for the agency: brand identity (baseline, claim), conception/creation (concepts, big ideas), campaigns (scripts, catchphrases) to activation (digital, events)
Respond and contribute to strategic briefs written by the agency's strategy and consulting teams
Assist our clients in building their brand (signature, manifesto, etc.) and their editorial and semantic strategy (editorial line, Tone of Voice.).
Design and adapt messages to the communication channels relevant to the issue and the audience (film, print, podcast, digital activation, social, etc.)
Present ideas and concepts to clients, in conjunction with the consulting team, demonstrating a clear vision of how our work addresses the initial brief
Write editorial content for digital and social media (articles, video scripts, social media posts, etc.), in French and English
Monitor and benchmark trends to ensure that the agency's projects are well thought out: innovation, campaigns, new formats, in corporate and B2C communication
Participate in calls for tenders and support recommendations to prospects.
Qualifications




Qualifications




You have an excellent command of French and English (native or bilingual).
You have a good knowledge of design and writing for all media (print, TV, digital, activations...) and all types of subjects - a particular sensitivity to the subjects of identity/brand strategy and employer brand is appreciated.
Proactive and curious, you are constantly on the lookout for relevant topics for our clients and prospects.
You know how to use words, both written and oral, to illustrate and defend your ideas through a strong narrative that generates commitment and engages your audience in a powerful storytelling.
You have a good capacity for analysis and synthesis.
Autonomous and rigorous, you have a sense of creativity, impeccable spelling, and a good general, and advertising, culture.
You demonstrate an ability to think through an idea or concept with a 360° vision.
You can prove these qualities with a portfolio.
Knowledge of SEO would be a plus.




Informations supplémentaires




Benefits:




Flex office, possibility of mobility in one of our offices in Nantes, Marseille or Lyon, telecommuting of 2/3 days per week possible
A transparent and attractive salary package
Training and career development programs
Referral bonuses




Work environment:




Spacious and modern offices near the Champs-Elysées; gym, spa, rooftop
International environment: 60+ nationalities in 38 offices and 18 countries (in cities such as New York, San Francisco, Amsterdam, London and Hong Kong)
Rich and impactful projects for world-class companies (e.g. GAFAM) and access to a network of specialists in 10+ Design Centers around the world
A dynamic and meritocratic environment, professionals with a high level of expertise in their field (Data Science, Blockchain, Web3, Metavers, etc.)
A fast-growing business with a young, motivated and open-minded team with a true entrepreneurial culture, focused on results




Work culture:




Caring and communication: a monthly Team Lunch, Q&A sessions with management, transparent discussions on our company's KPIs, and also afterworks!
Diversity and inclusion: a management based on benevolence and diversity, an equitable and inclusive culture, where our employees and partners thrive thanks to a sense of belonging
Intrapreneurship: the opportunity to participate in the creation, promotion and pitching of new offers within multidisciplinary internal squads
Open Innovation: an incubation studio for some of the most promising startups in the FrenchTech ecosystem
Positive Impact: projects that have a real impact on society and the environment, and office practices that favor waste reduction and respect for the environment

Title: Sr Product Designer (Data Viz + B2B) (Contract-to-Hire) [Remote]
Job_Description:
ABOUT US:

Braintrust is the only network that gives in-demand talent all the freedom of freelance with all the benefits, community and stability of a full-time role. As the first decentralized talent network, our revolutionary Web3 model ensures the community that relies on Braintrust to find work are the same people who own and build it through the blockchain token, BTRST. So unlike other marketplaces that take 20% to 50% of talent earnings, Braintrust allows talent to keep 100% of earnings and to vote on key changes to improve the network. Braintrust is working to change the way freelance works – for good.

JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)
LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: PST/CIST | Partial overlap)
HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $110 – $130/hr
ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term


THE OPPORTUNITY

What you’ll be working on

Our client's team is seeking a talented Senior Product Designer with strong UI skills and well versed in design systems!

Imagine yourself in the 1970s or 80s thinking through how computing should look and feel for people who had never seen it before. That's what they're trying to do — Their designers create powerful, impactful experiences that enable users of all kinds at organizations to work effectively with data to orchestrate complex marketing campaigns driven by AI. Sometimes that means cutting through the noise and delivering highly streamlined, simple experiences and sometimes it means designing productivity tools for very technical audiences.

They're excited to be growing a team as diverse and creative as the millions of people they reach worldwide, and a company where everyone can thrive.

What You Will Do

Design solutions to real problems and ship great features in their UI
Craft every detail of new product features, from idea to UX to pixel-perfect execution.
Work relentlessly to understand their customers
Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering and product to craft thorough experiences that are a joy to use
Work in the best medium for the stage of the product development lifecycle you're in, whether that be documents, mockups, prototypes, or presentations
Orient solutions around clear goals, audiences, timeframes, and realistic technical capabilities while always pushing to deliver the best possible experience
Participate in design reviews and share your work regularly with the design/product team and company leadership
Create new patterns that are intuitive, practical, and convergent. Evolve their design system intentionally as they scale.


What They’re Looking For

You have well-rounded skills and experience to run projects independently end to end. 6+ years of working experience designing consumer or business SaaS applications (Enterprise product experience is a plus).
You can create clear, intuitive, and visually appealing human interfaces. (UI)
You can untangle vague conceptual problems, and have a sharp intuition for the most accessible mental models and flows, so users can immediately start gaining value from the product. (UX)
You love making complex problems feel simple and seeing the larger system connect disparate pieces to visualize the user's journey
You have experience in designing Data systems with complex information hierarchies and representing the output of AI
The design decision you make are data driven
You can do basic coding in HTML + CSS + basic Javascript. (Even better if you're capable of the procedure or React-level Javascript.)
You care about the business needs, implications, and practicality of your designs. You don't get stuck on pretty UI or deep abstractions and can balance between craft, speed, and the bottom line.
You have strong beliefs, loosely held. You're a good listener who collaborates well with different stakeholders. You observe and internalize all inputs and feedback to help you reach an optimal decision.
You like to tell stories using both words and visuals and strategize the best way to make your point.
You have a strong portfolio that showcases your work, provides details of your role on projects, and shows examples of functional designs that you have developed from start to finish


Bonus points

You have experience working in the data and AI space
You have notion of motion design
You've designed and built great tools with small teams in the past.
You bring unique strengths and perspectives to the team. Our client is looking to build a diverse team where their skills and experience can complement each other.
You can polish features in the codebase.** They love to hire designers who can code so there's less communication and hand-off cost with engineers. But this is optional, especially if you are super talented in designing the purest and easiest solution to hard product design problems, and rallying your teammates to execute it.*
You've experienced the pain of fragmented tools and information silos created by them, and have a strong urge to fix it.


Apply Now!

ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:

Qualified candidates will be invited to do a screening interview with the Braintrust staff. We will answer your questions about the project, and our platform. If we determine it is the right fit for both parties, we'll invite you to join the platform and create a profile to apply directly for this project.

C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.

Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
